definition: blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
to be on intimate terms with sb (idiom)

sentences.english: This film records a story about the parents' blind date for their children.
sentences.chinese: 相親會記錄了老人們爲子女相親的故事。

sentences.english: This film records a story about the parents' blind date for their children.
sentences.chinese: 相親會記錄了老人們爲子女相親的故事。

sentences.english: They were a quiet and fond couple.
sentences.chinese: 他們夫婦一向和和睦睦，相親相愛。

sentences.english: I agree to go on a blind date as the matchmaker is my best friend.
sentences.chinese: 我同意去相親，因爲媒人是我最好的朋友。

sentences.english: They love each other, living in fairyland.
sentences.chinese: 他們相親相愛，生活如在仙境。

sentences.english: Hui and Rong fell in love with each other. His lower body became completely paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 輝和蓉相親相愛，但自從輝受傷後，下半身完全癱瘓。

sentences.english: A large-scale “blind date” fair will be held at People's Square on this Labor Day.
sentences.chinese: 這個勞動節在人民廣場會舉行一場大型的公開相親會。

sentences.english: Lingzhi thought he had no fast month of each other with their own skin.
sentences.chinese: 凌芝想到他已經快一個月沒有同自己肌膚相親了。

sentences.english: We wake up to find that we were dear to eachother.
sentences.chinese: 我醒了，卻知道我們原是相親相愛的。

sentences.english: Dating 365 times is failure, oneself become very self-abased.
sentences.chinese: 相親365次都是失敗，自己變得十分自卑。

sentences.english: Dear to each other in the USA, let a person infinite memories, good happiness.
sentences.chinese: 相親相愛的留影讓人無限回憶，美好了幸福。

sentences.english: They promise to love and cherish each other until death do them part.
sentences.chinese: 他們發誓相親相愛，至死不渝。

sentences.english: Before playing the song, they talked about match-making fees depending on ages.
sentences.chinese: 播歌之前他們談論關於相親費用是根據年齡而定的。

sentences.english: She started her matchmaking business on campus.
sentences.chinese: 她的相親事業開始與校園。

sentences.english: He is one of those guys who say they enjoy dating.
sentences.chinese: 他就是那些聲稱享受相親的人之一。

sentences.english: Blondie and Dagwood love each other.
sentences.chinese: 勃朗黛和大梧相親相愛。

definition: (romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to court/to go steady/to be dating
unmarried/single
exotic/foreign
different place/abroad
surname Tan
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
to marry/to get married/CL:次[ci4]
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
dad and mom
to let nature take its course (idiom)
appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to lose face/humiliation
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

to pay back/to return
